item.title: Women's View Radio: Jessica Nelson - May 09,2012
item.description:
Thirty-one year old Jessica Nelson became interested in antiques and all things vintage at a young age. This native Ohioan was dragged by her parents regularly into antiques shops and she developed a love and appreciation for older items as she found that they always had a story to tell. For years Jessica fantasized of opening a brick and mortar vintage clothing shop, so it was suggested to her that she start by opening an online store on Etsy.com, a place for vintage and hand-crafted items. She debuted Green Mountain Relics in November of 2010 and after having success with this venture, opened Mountain Mantiques in March of this year--a shop focusing on "manly" antiques. Unfortunately, the shops are not Jessicas "day job!" By day, she is the Assistant Director of Admissions at Marlboro College in southern Vermont. She earned a B.A. in speech communication from Miami University in 2003 and an M.A. in communication studies from the University of Iowa in 2006. She resides with her cat, Milano, in Brattlboro, VT, and spends her weekends hunting for treasures at antique stores, garage sales, thrifts stores and auctions. She has also started to "upcycle" some items--taking old items and giving them new life--to be featured in Green Mountain Relics soon.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Sheri Winston - Apr 26,2012
item.description:
Sheri Winston is one of the country’s most respected teachers about sex and sexuality. She has been a sex teacher for a decade and is the founder and executive director of the Kingston, NY-based Center for the Intimate Arts. She teaches at educational institutions, sexuality boutiques, women’s conferences, and many other types of venue.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Moonlight Serenaders - Apr 25,2012
item.description:
Were about to have a blast here at The Vintage Lifestyle Hour, chatting with the amazing Moonlight Serenaders! The Moonlight Serenade Orchestra has been performing great big band music since 2001! Come on out and join us for a nostalgic trip back to WW II and enjoy a re-creation of an authentic USO Canteen Show and Dance. If you’re a WWII veteran, perhaps you’ll look back to these USO dances fondly as some of the better memories of your war experience. Or, if you’ve seen great war movies like Pearl Harbor, Memphis Belle, 1941 or The Glenn Miller Story, you saw how the USO would provide entertainment for the troops and fliers by sponsoring dances featuring the leading dance bands and singers of the time. In order to accommodate the large crowds and provide shelter, the dances were often held inside the same hangars where aircraft were maintained, local auditoriums, hotel ballrooms or nightclubs.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Jake Maurer - Mar 27,2012
item.description:
Were joined today by talented Country music sensation Jake Maurer! Jake and the Naked Truth have been performing live for the past five years at Tootsies Orchid Lounge in Nashville, TN, all the while honing a sound all their own with hard hitting original tunes that are about to rock country music. As the front man, Jake Maurer, has a natural ability to entertain. His down to earth and charismatic style keeps the crowd rockin’ and the dance floor packed. Bring on the the history of country music as Jake and the Naked Truth incorporate “the good ole stuff” in medlies that keep the party going. The ability to bring a new sound and still be able to play the good old stuff is taking country music entertainment by storm.

The story of Victoria Ruvolos resilience has been making news since some kids out on a night of joyriding in November 2004 threw a frozen turkey out of their car and it went through Victorias windshield, destroying both the windshield and her face and leaving her near death as they drove away. pleded for mercy for her attacker and went with him to community service projects.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Donna Schwenk - Feb 09,2012
item.description:
The Gals chat with CulturedFood.coms Donna Schwenk! Donna Schwenk is the Kansas City Chapter leader for theWeston Price Foundation, a worldwide organization comprisedof people dedicated to restoring nutrient dense food to thehuman diet through education research and activism. She iscontinually teaching classes in the Kansas City area, toteach others what she has learned. She has been making andeating cultured foods since 2002. The dramatic change inher health and that of her family has given her a sense ofwell being that has been incredible. After years ofresearch, life experience, and teaching classes to helpothers, it is her pleasure to share it with you.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Charla Spence - Feb 07,2012
item.description:
The Gals chat with Charla Spence, who spent 27 years as a senior level manager At SCE, helping the company and its employees avoid and overcome mistakes. Combining her corporate background and family experience, Charla recognized the dangers of, and damage caused, by disorderly medical records. Drawing from real-life drama, she devised The Personal Healthcare Record to address real life needs. Even with so many medical offices and facilities turning to electronic records, Charla suggests keeping your own PHR. …. because mistakes get made, and you are your best advocate for your health care.

item.title: Women's View Radio: John Nelson - Feb 03,2012
item.description:
An interview with accomplished author John Nelson! "Irreverence is the adjective that first comes to mind when describing John Espinosa Nelson – irreverence and humor. For the past eight years, Nelson has collected and critiqued the public’s missing pet flyers, found wherever his travels take him. Writing under the pseudonym Harmsworth, and using such criteria as Emotional Hook, Coherency Index, and Cheap Shots, his treasury can be found online in his Desperate Housepets Internet archive."

item.title: Women's View Radio: Tara Sheahan - Jan 31,2012
item.description:
Tara Sheahan chats with the Gals today on WVR! Tara Sheahan is clearly a self-accomplished woman. An elite athlete, Tara was Middlebury’s first two-sport All American (cross country running and skiing), was on the US Cross Country Ski Team, and was in close pursuit to make the Winter Olympic Team in from 2003-2005. Tara’s work now is about awakening consciousness. She believes that success and prosperity begins with consciousness – the capacity to expand your horizon of thinking and your understanding of the universe around you, the principles which govern you.

item.title: Women's View Radio: DeLores Pressley - Jan 20,2012
item.description:
Special treat! The Gals chat with DeLores Pressley! DeLores Pressley started the UP Woman Organization to fill the unmet needs of todays woman. Todays woman is forging new territories in career, business, politics, government, and personal growth, yet have fewer opportunities for networking and mentoring than men do. Survey is included in the press release attached.DeLores has been a guest on the Oprah Winfrey Show, and featured on Entertainment Tonight for a segment featuring her Plus size woman modeling agency beauty pageant. She has since closed that business, and is a frequent sought after speaker for motivation and inspiration globally. She started the UP Woman as an answer so many women had after her motivational talks for more support. The UP (Undeniably Powerful) Woman is an answer to that call.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Ty M. Bollinger - Jan 17,2012
item.description:
Guest Ty M. Bollinger on the air LIVE today! Why I wrote this book: During the last 15 years, I’ve lost 7 close family members due to cancer. I have devoted the last decade of my life to medical research to find alternative cancer treatments and cures so YOU and YOUR family don’t have to experience the same tragedy. I have summarized this voluminous amount of research on natural cancer treatments in my book, Cancer-Step Outside the Box. Ty is not a medical doctor (see disclaimer).

item.title: Women's View Radio: Stephen Gallup - Jan 10,2012
item.description:
Were live with Stephen Gallup, author of "What About The Boy? A Fathers Pledge To His Disabled Son": Born in the mid 1980’s, nobody knew what had hurt little Joseph … a pre-natal toxin, a genetic fault, a difficult birth? Whatever the cause, something had gone terribly wrong—but no one was offering solutions or guidance. His parents were helpless… or were they? According to the Center for Disease Control: out of 4 million births in the U.S. each year, at least one in every 110 children has an autism-spectrum disorder - over 36,000 per year! At a time when developmental disabilities were a medical mystery, Stephen and Judy Gallup paved the way for future families. They had to decide to trust themselves and not just listen to the doctors.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Stephen J. Iacoboni, MD - Dec 20,2011
item.description:
The hosts chat with author of "The Undying Soul- A Cancer Doctor’s Discovery", Stephen J. Iacoboni, MD! --------------------------------------------- For decades Stephen Iacoboni, MD, carried John Donne’s words with him, “No man is an island …every man’s death diminishes me…therefore, do not send to know…for whom the bell tolls…it tolls for me.” Every patient’s death begged questions. Cancer moves more slowly today, thanks to modern science. But science provides scant solace when it fails, slowly, to save our physical forms … and religious faith too often proves fragile during a long mortal watch. Stephen J. Icaboni, MD, served his fellowship in medical oncology at the prestigious MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston where he received the outstanding researcher award and was honored to present his research findings at the American Society of Clinical Oncology. In 1989 Dr. Icaboni co-founded St. Mary’s Regional Cancer Center in Walla Walla Washington, where he lived and practiced for 16 years. He accepted the position of Medical Director at the Kootenai Cancer Center in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho in 2001, and in 2010 returned to Washington to co-direct the Kennewick General Hospital Hematology-Oncology program.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Doug Noll - Dec 17,2011
item.description:
The gals sit down tonight with the author of Elusive Peace, Doug Noll! After a successful 22 year trial career, Douglas E. Noll found litigation to be a wasteful way to resolve conflicts, and earned his Masters Degree in Peacemaking and Conflict Studies. Today, Douglas is a nationally recognized mediator, international peace advocate and speaker, and professor. He hosts The Doug Noll Show, a weekly radio program dedicated to giving a voice to international peacemakers. His current pro bono project Prison of Peace trains murderers committed to life sentences in the largest women’s prison in the world to become peacemakers and mediators.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Author Russ Lippitt - Nov 02,2011
item.description:
VLH is excited to chat with Russ Lippitt, author of coming-of-age Greaser novel "The Lions Share"! "Russ Lippitt hails from the lower class projects of New Jersey’s finest. Raised by a drug-dealing Hell’s Angel biker he called Dad and a pole-dancing junkie, his future was almost written in stone. Through writing, Russ had found his escape from reality by creating a world worse than his own. In his teen years, he had often bumped head’s with the law; so, naturally, inspired by Punk Rock and Anarchist views, he set out to become a rule-breaking writer, dedicating himself to learning the rules just to deconstruct them more fully and artistically. To this end, he shipped himself off to The Academy of Arts College to polish his writing talent. In the vein of anti-hero writer’s such as Charles Bukowski, Hunter S. Thompson, and Frank Miller, Russ Lippitt’s writing is enveloped in chaos and mayhem that incorporates his love for the rebellious fifties. In every bit of prose, Russ Lippitt’s objective is to get his readers to cheer for the villain and acknowledge that ‘The grass is not always greener on the other side if you burn it down.’ Because, for this author, anarchy is not just another word to be thrown around and dismissed as useless rhetoric, it’s a way of life."

item.title: Women's View Radio: Kim Stewart of Nudeedudee - Sep 28,2011
item.description:
Vintage Lifstyle Hour has a fun guest today, the fabulous Kim Stewart of Nudeedudee (how awesome is that name?)! Nudeedudee is an etsy shop begun by Kim Stewart in 2008 featuring custom made reproduction vintage clothing. Her love of hunting for vintage patterns and fabrics to make clothes for herself created a serious stash. She uses all vintage patterns from the 1930s-50s to create the clothing, along with the original fabrics and buttons (or a good modern replica upon request). The shop took off early on with custom requests flying in from all around the globe. The hobby soon became a full-time endeavor. Kim will create the customized look youve been dreaming of in the style and fabrics you choose, how fun!

item.title: Women's View Radio: Vintage Suits by Mary - Aug 31,2011
item.description:
The summer isnt over yet! The Vintage Lifestyle Hour is graced tonight with Vintage Suits by Mary! Fun in the sun is what Vintage Suits by Mary is all about! We make period perfect, retro playsuits and swimwear. We are a California based company. We specialize in authentic retro styling with fantastic construction and support (boning, cups, zippers, etc.). With over 30 years experience in the apparel industry, we pay very close attention to fit and function. Our fabrics have that vintage look with todays technology for comfort and support to make you look and feel wonderful while swimming or playing. We cater to every doll, from the shy violet to the sassy siren!

With over 30 years experience in the apparel industry, we pay very close attention to fit and function. Our fabrics have that vintage look with todays technology for comfort and support to make you look and feel wonderful while swimming or playing. We cater to every doll, from the shy violet to the sassy siren!

item.title: Women's View Radio: Free To Breathe - Aug 26,2011
item.description:
The Gals are chatting, tonight, with Dr. Regina Vidaver, Judly Oetting and Kiers Rowley of the Free To Breathe Lung Cancer Fundraiser! Regina Vidaver PhD - the Executive Director of National Lung Cancer Partnership, the organization putting on the event. The Partnership is a group of leading doctors, researchers, patient advocates, and lung cancer survivors who are working together to improve treatments for lung cancer patients. Judy Oetting – The Free to Breathe Kansas City event is in her daughter’s memory. Judy’s daughter Lt. Colonel Julia Miles was a healthy and active 43-year-old nurse that never smoked. She passed away about a year after she was diagnosed. Judy isn’t the main organizer, her niece and her husband are, but she’s continuing the battle on Julia’s behalf. Kiers Rowley – Was diagnosed with lung cancer in 2008 at the age of 38. A healthy, classically trained singer, Kiers has never smoked and never thought lung cancer could happen to her.

item.title: Women's View Radio: The Minsky Sisters - Aug 24,2011
item.description:
Fresh from the Jazz Age Lawn Party come the 1920s tap sensations, the fabulous Minsky Sisters! The Gals are excited to chat with Gin and Kristen Minsky about their act, period dress and everything in between - feel free to give us a call! "The glittery gals are swingin and shufflin, tappin and flappin their way around speakeasy street, hoping to give you a glimpse of what has been referred to as "sizzle"! Tap dancing sensations, Gin and Kristen Minsky make up the hottest act to surface in the Cabaret scene in years! The Minsky Sisters have been moving their way into the hearts of audiences across the country for over three years now and have received awards such as "Best Burlesque Act" by Loungerati two years in a row. They have been featured in Zelda Magazine, the New York Times Style Section, and have been more recently honored with an illustration of their likeness published in The New Yorker. "

item.title: Women's View Radio: Rosina Rothman of Retro Girl's Guide - Aug 17,2011
item.description:
Louise and Deborah get to chat with the fabulous Rosina Rothman of Retro Girls Guide, your guide to vintage glamour in a modern world! " I published a kitschy magazine several years ago that you might remember called Modern Lounge. Although life has changed throughout the years, my love of classic, retro style hasn’t. My goal for the Retro Girl’s Guide is to be the source for all vintage and retro inspired reproductions for today’s contemporary gal (and guys!). It’s like Modern Lounge Part 2. And though I love authentic vintage items, this site will focus mainly on new designs that are available to the public. A vintage dress is lovely, but it’s even lovelier when you can find it in your size. I will also showcase photographers, pin-up models, how-to tips, contests and much more! If you have any suggestions, I’d love to hear from you."

item.title: Women's View Radio: Dolly Marlowe - Aug 10,2011
item.description:
The VLR on Womens View is VERY excited to have international pin-up Dolly Marlowe with us! *Im a professional vintage pinup model. Ive been featured in Pinup Perfection Magazine, Ol Skool Rodz, Car Kulture Deluxe, Pinup Lifestyle, Dirty Rotten Rides, Rebel Pinups, Heartbreaker Fashion and some uncredited bits in Vintage Lifestyle and a few others. Though, most of my work is for private clientele in gallery shows, advertising, and the like. *Im the president and co-founder of the Pinup Patriettes, a military support and charity group http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pinup-Patriettes/115267705160970?ref=ts Were going to be doing a charity car wash on the 27th of August in Apple Valley, CA (Id love to plug that)! *I write a vintage fashion and living blog, the Dolly Marlowe Diaries http://dollymarlowe.blogspot.com/ where I yammer about fashion, food, events, anything I really feel like at the moment. *Im also a dancer (non-stripping) and cabaret chanteuse. Ive performed at Mondaynight Tease in Hollywood, CA and Ive opened for country music star Aaron Tippin. *I love all things vintage! Im a HUGE movie buff. Im all about glamour every day.

item.title: Women's View Radio: The Marjorie Belles - Aug 03,2011
item.description:
The Girls get the pleasure of chatting with amazing Andrews Sisters-esque singing group, The Marjorie Belles! Official Site + Facebook "The Marjorie Belles will add some 40s glamour with their enchanting close-harmony singing of classics such as "Dont Sit Under the Apple Tree," and "Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy," and other hits from the wartime era. Their highly versatile act can be tailored to suit cabaret evenings, parties, weddings and corporate events. The Marjorie Belles are three vocalists with a piano, but they also have big-band charts for many of the songs in their repertoire, so whatever the scale of your event, they can make it happen! Whatever the occasion, the Marjorie Belles will work with you to create your own bespoke programme of songs."

item.title: Women's View Radio: Author Nancy Stanley - Aug 01,2011
item.description:
WVR would like to welcome back Nancy Stanley, author of Pillow with a Heartbeat: "Nancy Stanley’s inspiration to write Pillow with a Heartbeat came from a young girl, Michelle Butler, who was battling leukemia. Nancy was her wish granter with the Make-A-Wish Foundation. The bond Michelle, Nancy, and Truffles had was life changing. Truffles was Michelle’s therapy dog and he brought her much joy while she battled the disease. Michelle passed away in 2009 and to this day, her family still thanks Truffles for all the happiness and love he gave. "

item.title: Women's View Radio: Rebecca McWattie - Jul 06,2011
item.description:
This weeks Vintage Lifestyle Hour guest is the sensational founder of Stop Traffic Clothing, Rebecca McWattie! Stop Traffic Clothing was founded by vintage & period fashion expert Rebecca McWattie. Rebecca’s love of retro clothing began as a teenager through watching the movies of Audrey Hepburn and Grace Kelly. Even though some of the films were shot in black and white the sophistication and classic lines of the clothing stood out and started her quest to find manufacturers reproducing styles from the 40s and 50s.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Singing Sensation RIA - Jun 23,2011
item.description:
The gals sit down and chat with singing sensation RIA! Singing since she was able to talk and performing since she was 6 years old, RIA is capable of singing in any genre that is requested of her. She has been compared to such artists as Jewel and Christina Aguilera with the maturity, charisma and professionalism of any adult recording artist. Ohh yeah, RIA is a mere 16 years old! With her amazing voice naturally a gift from God, each word RIA sings comes straight from her heart and delivered with such soul. It will bring tears to even the strongest of mens eyes. Not just another Teen Singer, RIA has skills from performing all these years, combined with unstoppable youthful energy that results in an accomplished true artist. At the young age of 11, RIA performed solo with conductor Keith Lockhart and the Boston Symphony Orchestra, which he was quoted saying : RIA has it all a voice, communicativeness and just enough attitude to know she belongs on the stage." RIA is able to capture her audience bringing them into a magical world all her own and has true star quality that you can only be born with. RIA has performed in numerous stage productions including a one girl show in NYC that was written exclusively for her. She has performed many live concerts and benefit events and has won a phenomenal amount of awards including "Best Pop Artist" at the Music on and Up Concert held at the Hard Rock Café in Boston and was one of the top four finalists in the Berklee College of Music Battle of the Bands!

item.title: Women's View Radio: The Tropigals - Jun 22,2011
item.description:
This week on WVRs Vintage Lifestyle Hour the hosts get to chat with the amazing TropiGals! The TropiGals are the dames of which dreams are made! Looking back, but always moving forward, The Gals reference a time when the silver screen required triple threat talent and Hollywood was as it will always remain in our collective memory; a place of fantasies, glitz, and glamour. Conquering the hearts of New England with high kicks, back flips, and vocals to boot, The Gals always put on a show, a swipe of lipstick, and a smile to bring a level of entertainment gone by in the films, supper clubs and USO shows of yesteryear. The TropiGals perform regularly as a part of the vintage culture community at neo-vaudeville shows, supper clubs, and variety revues.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Gabriela Hernandez of Bésame Cosmetics - Jun 15,2011
item.description:
Our third Vintage Lifestyle Hour has a special guest! Were catching up with Gabriela Hernandez, founder of Bésame Cosmetics! Gabrielas professional career includes photography, art direction, fine art painting and design commissions. Also an accomplished make-up artist and cosmetic historian, Gabrielas perspective is truly unique. Launched in September 2004, Bésame Cosmetics was a culmination of Gabrielas passion for design and her desire to create an original cosmetic with details and formulas that make women feel glamorous and unique. Gabriela created Bésame to become a company that reaches beyond the product, one with solid morals, which acts as a strong role model for young women.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Author Nancy Stanley - Jun 02,2011
item.description:
The gals sit down with Nancy Stanley, author of Pillow with a Heartbeat: "Nancy Stanley’s inspiration to write Pillow with a Heartbeat came from a young girl, Michelle Butler, who was battling leukemia. Nancy was her wish granter with the Make-A-Wish Foundation. The bond Michelle, Nancy, and Truffles had was life changing. Truffles was Michelle’s therapy dog and he brought her much joy while she battled the disease. Michelle passed away in 2009 and to this day, her family still thanks Truffles for all the happiness and love he gave. "

item.title: Women's View Radio: Gloria Burgess - May 31,2011
item.description:
The gals get another chance to talk to Gloria Burgess! Dr. Gloria Burgess loves nothing more than inspiring others to create a bridge from what was, and what is, to what can be . . . and shes dedicated her entire life to doing just that. An author, speaker, executive coach, and consultant who engages individuals and organizations in the process of finding the vital core of their creative self. Gloria weaves together her own personal legacy using the threads of authenticity, creativity, soulful living, and cultural inclusivity.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Paleoanthropologist Hank Wesselman - May 25,2011
item.description:
The gals sit and chat with Research paleoanthropologist Hank Wesselman about his book "Research paleoanthropologist Hank Wesselman is one of those rare cutting edge scientists who truly walks between the worlds. He did his undergraduate work, as well as his Masters Degree, in Zoology at the University of Colorado at Boulder, then went on to receive his doctoral degree in Anthropology from the University of California at Berkeley. A native New Yorker, he has spent much of his life living and working among traditional tribal peoples, primarily in Africa and Polynesia. He served in the US Peace Corps in the 1960s, living among people of the Yoruba Tribe in Western Nigeria for two years. It was there that he first became interested in indigenous spiritual wisdom."

item.title: Women's View Radio: Author Gloria Burgess - May 18,2011
item.description:
The gals chat live with the fantastic Gloria Burgess, author of Dare to Wear Your Soul on the Outside! Dr. Gloria J. Burgess is an international speaker, innovative corporate consultant, and executive coach. Working with people of all cultures, ages, and life circumstances, she speaks and leads workshops on leadership, personal development, and cultural diversity throughout the world. She is the Founder and Principal of Jazz, Inc., a professional consulting and coaching firm for corporations and individuals. Gloria and her colleagues at Jazz, Inc. design comprehensive, customized, on-site professional development programs in leadership, management, cross-cultural diversity, creativity, and innovation. Her client portfolio includes such institutions as Boeing, AT&T, Microsoft, MSNBC, Adobe Systems, Cingular, Qwest, Providence Health System, International Coach Federation, and the Girl Scouts of America.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Flooding The Mississippi River - May 16,2011
item.description:
A steel, 10-ton floodgate was slowly raised Saturday for the first time in nearly four decades, unleashing a torrent of water from the Mississippi River, away from heavily populated areas downstream. The water spit out slowly at first, then began gushing like a waterfall as it headed to swamp as much as 3,000 square miles of Cajun countryside known for small farms and fish camps. Some places could wind up under as much as 25 feet of water. Opening the Morganza spillway diverts water away from Baton Rouge and New Orleans, and the numerous oil refineries and chemical plants along the lower reaches of the Mississippi.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Charlene Costanzo, The 13th Gift - May 05,2011
item.description:
Charlene Gorda Costanzo is an award-winning author, workshop facilitator, wife, mother of two adult daughters, and grandmother of twins. She holds a B.A. in Philosophy from St. Bonaventure University and an M.A. in Spiritual Psychology from the University of Santa Monica. Originally from New Jersey, she has resided in New York, Texas, Arizona, and Florida. During a one-year book tour to launch The Twelve Gifts of Birth, Charlene and her husband enjoyed living in an RV in 48 of the 50 states. The Twelve Gifts series of fables began in 1987 when Charlene wrote The Twelve Gifts of Birth as a life message for her own, then teenage daughters. Twelve years later she published the book and discussed its message in schools, shelters, prisons, churches, and hospitals throughout the United States. The Twelve Gifts for Healing was written while Charlene was in treatment for advanced non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma in 2001. “Cancer led me to examine my convictions and look at these life gifts more deeply. Truly, they helped me heal,” she says. The Twelve Gifts in Marriage comes from the ups and downs, ebbs and flows, and hurts and healings that are a part of every long-term marriage.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Wendy Cohan of The Better Bladder Book - Apr 28,2011
item.description:
Wendy Cohan, RN, is a health educator and health writer living in Portland, Oregon. She is the author of "The Better Bladder Book - A Holistic Approach to Healing Interstitial Cystitis & Chronic Pelvic Pain (Hunter House, 2010; www.thebetterbladderbookinfo.com). A practicing nurse for 16 years, Wendy now helps individuals take charge of their recovery from chronic health issues including celiac disease, gluten intolerance, interstitial cystitis, and chronic pelvic pain (see www.WellBladder.com and www.glutenfreechoice.com). She is married to David F. Cohan, and is the proud mother of two University of Montana college students. Her first book was "Gluten Free PORTLAND - A Resource Guide" (2007, Wendy L. Cohan; it can be ordered at www.glutenfreechoice.com).

item.title: Women's View Radio: Karen McCall author of Financial Recover - Apr 25,2011
item.description:
Louise and Deborah talk to Karen McCall about her book Financial Recovery! Whether you are suffering under crushing debt, unable to save money, or if you are caught in the tangle of inherited wealth, Karen McCall’s Financial Recovery (New World Library, May 2011) offers a time-tested plan for building a stable and satisfying way of life — and keeping it that way. Forget budgets that don’t work, quick-fixes that fail, and yo-yo debting. Financial Recovery presents a simple system that enables people to discover their underlying attitudes about money — often the cause of self-defeating money behaviors such as overspending, chronic debt, under-earning, and low or no savings — while providing the tools, strategies, and support to achieve financial well-being and demonstrate what McCall deems ‘sterling’ money behavior. Karen McCallis the founder and owner of the Financial Recovery Institute. Since 1988, McCall has counseled individuals, couples, businesses, and a wide variety of recovery groups through a holistic, transformational approach that results in a stable and secure financial foundation. She lives in Sonoma County, CA and her website is www.FinancialRecovery.com.

item.description:
This week Deborah and Louise have the pleasure of talking with Charlene Costanzo, author of The Thirteenth Gift. Ever since she wrote The Twelve Gifts of Birth, Charlene Costanzo mused about a scene in its opening. What might have happened when: “The wise women came to understand that the twelve royal gifts of birth belong to every child… yearned to proclaim the gifts to all children…but the customs of the land did not allow that.” The Thirteenth Gift. This fourth work in The Twelve Gifts series also explains why so many people world-wide are fascinated with stones. While on assignment in Eastern Europe, Claire, a U.S. journalist, learns of a local legend when she stoops for a stone. The deceptively simple story about “the thirteenth gift” has a profound effect on Claire, which soon transforms her marriage, her work, and the way she sees the world. The Thirteenth Gift is both a cautionary tale and an inspirational fable as it shows a way through the perilous consequences of greed, arrogance, and abuse of power to an uplifted state of consciousness and community. The Thirteenth Gift invites readers to renew their sense of wonderment, which can lead to freedom from fear and to a greater experience of hope, beauty, and joy in daily life. You can check out Charlenes amazing work at http://charlenecostanzo.com/

item.title: Women's View Radio: Interview with Gates BBQ in Kansas City, MIssouri - Apr 04,2011
item.description:
Louise and Deborah talk to the owners of the iconic Gates BBQ in Kansas City, Missouri! Gates Bar-B-Q is a Kansas City original. Our family restaurant established in 1946, has grown from a single store front at 19th & Vine to a family of six up to date restaurants throughout the Kansas City Metropolitan area; all struttin' the Gates Bar-B-Q unique red roof design and man in full tuxedo top hat, depicting our style. Over 60 years of excellence, hard work and our family recipe has perpetuated the growth of our sauce line to a family of sauces, all with the distinct flavor found only in Gates Bar-B-Q products. All our restaurants, sauce products and seasonings serve as a conduit between us and our customers' satisfaction. The connection of good food; fast, personalized service and an immediate greeting of "Hi, May I Help You?" All act as our trademarks. Gates will continue in the family tradition and pride ourselves in producing the best Bar-B-Q products possible. Visit them on the web at www.GatesBBQ.com!

item.title: Women's View Radio: Interview with Lois Joy Johnson, author of The Makeup Wakeup - Mar 24,2011
item.description:
Deborah and Louise chat with Lois Joy Johnson, author of The Makeup Wakeup! Lois Joy Johnson is a beauty editor and leading expert on style for women 40+. As one of the founding editors of More magazine, she helped launch the Pro-Age Era, working for more than a decade exclusively with models, celebrities, and real women in their forties, fifties, and sixties. Lois has interviewed and photographed hundreds of women who changed the face of beauty and revised our attitudes towards aging. They include Christy Brinkley, Paulina Porizkova, Lauren Hutton, Carol Alt, Isabella Rossellini, Ann Curry, Carolina Herrera, Meredith Viera, Jamie Lee Curtis, and Diane Keaton. She has been a frequent contributor to The Today Show, The Early Show, Extra, and CNN.

item.title: Women's View Radio: Sheila Dean of BeatTheChip.org - Mar 01,2011
item.description:
Our economy and government are going through tremendous strains from financial and budgetary shortfalls. In the past, this has worked to slow implementation of the deeply flawed Real ID program. Real ID, like many federal programs, are headed for budget cuts. This would stop federal subsidies to develop local Real ID database hub infrastructure; which would be both insecure, damaging to privacy and civil liberty. Many of you have been committed to actions which helped to combat a dangerous national ID card program in the US. Right now, we really need you to raise your voice again, to spread the truth and to ask Congress to defund Real ID.
